snippet: A new study focuses on what happens to animals and plants when grapes are planted in new habitats.
abstract: Study published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences examines effects vineyards have on local ecosystems, particularly in light of models that predict that 47 percent of land suitable for vineyards will be lost due to global warming.
lead_paragraph: A new study focuses on what happens to animals and plants when grapes are planted in new habitats.

headline.seo: Scientists Question Impact as Vineyards Turn Up in New Places
headline.main: Scientists Question Impact as Vineyards Turn Up in New Places
headline.print_headline: Scientists Question Impact as Vineyards Turn Up in New Places
